title: Great Place to stay
text: Such a beautiful place, with a big gorgeous lobby. The pool and hot tub were lovely. The breakfast was good, with a nice selection of cold and hot choices. The staff were friendly and the views were really great. I really liked the feel of the hotel - it didn't feel like a big chain. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Good wines and great service
text: We had so much fun trying a bunch of Merkin wines. We asked the waitress to surprise us so she brought out the Chupacabra series of wines, and we took our time trying each one, then we picked our favorite to enjoy with a charcuterie that was excellent.
place: Merkin Vineyards Tasting Room and Osteria

title: Stepping into the past
text: We stopped to take a look and spend almost two hours. There are FIVE buildings full of antiques. Even the music playing is a fun blast from the past. There is so much to see. This place is a gem.

title: So yummy
text: My husband made plans for our anniversary dinner and it was amazing. The service was great and they even had a sweet happy anniversary card on the table for us. We had King crab legs and my hubby added a small prime rib to his. It was so tender and good. They even gave us a free anniversary desert - The chocolate cake was incredible. Thanks Murphy's for making our anniversary extra special.

title: Excellent pizza
text: Stopped here for some pizza and we are so glad we did. I had the deep dish Hawaiian and it was fantastic, hubby had thin crust with pepperoni and mushrooms and he loved it. Prompt service and good prices.

title: OMG Sooooo Good
text: This was absolutely fantastic BBQ. The service was friendly and prompt and the food was so good. We had pulled pork and ribs and even the cornbread was fresh and delicious.

title: Friendly staff and incredible food
text: There are many choices in the area but I am so glad I chose this one, the food was fabulous, and we were even surprised by a complimentary plate of greek yogurt and honey for dessert.

title: Wow
text: It is truly stunning to view and wander through the ancient ruins. The restored areas help to give visitors an idea of the grandeur of this incredible place. An absolute must see when in Athens. Be prepared to walk on uneven surfaces.

title: Incredible Museum
text: After visiting the Acropolis a stop at this museum is a fantastic way to round out your experience. Beautiful exhibits on three floors with a lovely outside cafe with a view of the Acropolis makes your visit even more special. My favorite was the third floor which gives you an idea of the actual size of the Parthenon.

title: Great facility in a Good location
text: The hotel staff were pleasant and helpful, the breakfast buffet was wonderful and the rooms are clean. The location is within walking distance to popular tourist areas and a wide variety of restaurants.

title: Testing our Limits with teamwork
text: Our family had a blast, we did the Lost Dutchman room and although it was challenging our group mastered the puzzles with time to spare. We will definitely come back to try our luck with the Infirmary.

title: What a fun tour
text: Really enjoyed this tour full of history and humor. There was a wide selection of beer and I enjoyed sampling many of the varieties. The pretzel with cheese was fantastic.

title: Beautiful park with great views
text: Right on the water, with spectacular views, this fun park has so many options for activities. A great place for a family day of fun

title: Essential for any Packer fan
text: A fantastic review of the Packers organization. The Hall of Fame highlighted the best of the Packer moments through the years, my cheesehead husband was thrilled to explore each exhibit.
place: Green Bay Packer Hall of Fame

title: There is nothing quite like a Game at Lambeau
text: This iconic stadium is a delight for all football fans, but it is an absolute must for packers fans. Every seat has a great view of the game.

title: A Fun tour but be prepared to walk
text: My daughter and I had a blast on the Jack Daniels Distillery tour. We were going to do a tasting but since we had my 11 month old grandson with us we could only do the dry tour. A tour guide takes you all throughout the property explaining the distilling process & our tour guide was great. Be prepared to walk a bunch, but I guarantee you will learn a lot about whiskey making and have some fun.

title: Wow - What incredible food
text: Miss Mary Bobo's is a unique dining experience. My daughter and I could barely walk we were so stuffed by the time we left. 'Dinner' is served in individual rooms and a room hostess eats along with you as she shares information about the Boarding house and Miss Mary Bobo. The food was simply wonderful and they encourage you to ask for as many helpings as you would like. The cheddar garlic grits were simply amazing, the friend okra, cornbread muffins and the the baked apples. Each meal is different and our main course included ribs and delicious chicken pot pie. Miss Mary Bobo's is a must if you visit Lynchburg

title: Its not just whiskey in Lynchburg
text: Entering the small store front is deceptive, this little winery is really quite big. For only $5 you get to sample several local wines and even keep the glass as a souvenir. The staff were friendly and the wines were decent for southern wines (sorry I am more partial to the bolder wines in Napa).

title: Delicious
text: Although we arrived late (30 minutes before closing) the staff were gracious and friendly and the food was simply incredible. Sadly it was after dark when we arrived so we missed the view of the river, but that just means we have to come back again sometime.

title: Elegance and Charm
text: I wanted something different that just a chain hotel and this place was perfect. From the quaint lobby,to the beautifully artwork and furnishings, The Burgundy was wonderful. The staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were spacious and comfortable. I would recommend The Burgundy to anyone who needs to visit Little Rock
place: The Burgundy Hotel, Tapestry Collection by Hilton

title: Bubbles
text: A fun place to visit with beautiful views and fantastic wines. The line was long but it was worth it. The patio is beautiful.

title: Gorgeous views
text: The views from the patio were lovely, but one of the servers refused to let our group sit at the edge of the patio which was very disappointing. Overall the wines were great and our server was friendly but I was so disappointed at the behavior of the first staff that we dealt with.

title: Wow! What a great way to spend the afternoon
text: This winery was crowded but so worth it. The gondola ride up the mountain was lovely, the views are stunning. The self guided wine tour was fabulous with fantastic views around every corner. The wines were okay on the self-guided tour, but we also did the VIP tasting at the top and those wines were simply fabulous. We thoroughly enjoyed the pairing selections with our wines. I would recommend this winery to anyone.

title: A beautiful property with fantastic wines
text: Open an hour later than some of the vineyards, Luna is the perfect way to end your day of wine tasting. These wines were excellent and don't miss the dessert wine (not on the regular wine tasting but worth asking for). The only downside was that the tasting room was little noisy, but Luna is a must-see for any Napa visit.

title: Disappointing
text: Of all the Napa & Sonoma wineries I visited, this was my least favorite - which is a shame because the property is stunning, with gorgeous views, but the staff we dealt with were not extremely friendly. The staff who poured our tasting offered very little info and the wines were just not that great. There are so many incredible choices in the area, I would not recommend this property.

title: Great service
text: Came to Arrivederchi for a special birthday dinner. The service was wonderful. The waiter recommended the Cucumber Lime Martini and it was fantastic. We had the jumbo cheese ravioli special with shrimp and lobster sauce and my husband was licking the plate clean. Then they surprised us with a special chocolate torte and some Limoncello as a birthday treat. I am so glad we came her for my birthday, it was fantastic.

title: Tasting incredible flavors of Moonshine....what's not to love
text: Free tasting samples of moonshine in so many incredible flavors. It was a bit crowded, but the staff are friendly and efficient

title: Beautiful
text: It is a bit surreal, walking in Nashville and feeling like you just got dropped into Ancient Greece. The Athena statue is huge and gorgeous, and the other works are interesting too.

title: So Much Fun - Josh is incredible
text: So glad we came here - Josh was amazing, he was so entertaining and the whiskey was incredible. Josh shared so many great recipes for the whiskey - and the flavors were fantastic. There are lots of places to taste spirits in Gatlinburg, but this was my favorite.

title: Really good meal
text: My family took a break from our sightseeing in Gatlinburg and stopped in here for some lunch. Our server was wonderful, the atmosphere was fun and the food was good. Everyone seemed to enjoy their meal and the prices were mid-range.

title: Digging in dirt and Mining for Gems - what's not to love
text: My daughter loves gems and minerals so this was a must. We got a large bucket for everyone to share and found so many cook gems and fossils. A great family activity.

title: Great Wines
text: Super friendly service and free samples of wine, the flavors are mostly sweet, but a good range. The server was so pleasant and took her time explaining each one. The muscadine wines are very unique and we loved the wine slushy so much we had to get some.

title: Martinis with a view
text: My daughter and I came up for some drinks and the happy hour specials were great. The views of the river were spectacular, especially at sunset. We had some appetizers and tried several of the various martinis. The service was friendly and we really enjoyed it.

title: DON'T FLY with Allegiant
text: Before you book with that LOW price let me warn you that you get what you pay for.....PLEASE avoid flying on Allegiant airlines, there is an extra charge for literally everything, and then our flight home was cancelled and after waiting on the phone for over 40 minutes they offered no help at all and we were told there are no flights today Yeah so....lesson learned #NeverFlyAllegiant

title: Old School Elegance
text: No trip to Memphis would be complete without a trip to see the Peabody and their world famous ducks. The Lobby is gorgeous. Elegant touches and stunning architectural design make The Peabody a true landmark.

title: BBQ and Blues
text: Beale street is a must if you visit Memphis. There are so many yummy places to choose from. I thoroughly enjoyed my Memphis Barbecue at 'Pig, Pork with an Attitude'. Parking can be tricky in downtown, but Beale street is close to most major hotels and attractions.

title: Hidden gem - worth a trip
text: Mud Island Park is set in a stunning location, right next to the Mississippi River, just below the I-40 bridge, the view s are spectacular. The park includes a fantastic model of the entire lower Mississippi and the Museum was a true hidden gem. Beautiful exhibits that she the story of the river, and the great river boats that have sailed up and down the waters of the Mississippi for hundreds of years. Replicas of old time steam boats are enchanting for young and old visitors alike. The museum entrance of only $10 includes a ticket for the monorail - offering spectacular views of downtown Memphis.

title: Lots to see and do - for young and old alike
text: We were pleasantly surprised by this lovely museum offering a wonderful look into the history of the River and the river boats that rode up and down these waters.
place: Mississippi River Museum at Mud Island

title: Cute little historic park
text: It is a cute little park with fantastic views of the Mississippi River, and the canons and statues are interesting, but I find it hard to commemorate the Confederate leaders and soldiers in such a 'proud' way. If I didn't know what actually happened in history, I would believe the south won the war based on these plaques.

title: Wish I could give more than 5 stars
text: River Inn of Harbor Town is located right next to the Mississippi River, in a beautiful neighborhood. The staff were amazing and friendly, and there were so many sweet touches, from a glass of win at check in, to live paino music in the quaint little lobby bar, to the Port wine and Chocolate truffles waiting in our room each night. My daughter and I loved this hotel. It has a sweet southern charm and we felt safe and comfortable. We were so pleased with the incredible breakfast at Paulines, included in the cost of the room. The views of the river are so nice and the hotel is in a great location. All of the downtown tourist attractions are only a few minutes away by car (too far to walk). For less than the price of the downtown hotels for a much nicer experience, I can't imagine staying anyone else.

title: Incredible
text: I can't recommend this museum enough. The exhibits were so well done, so meaningful and beautiful. The bus that Rosa Parks sat on, the Freedom Riders bus that was destroyed, and of course the room where Dr. King spent his last day. This museum is such an important part of history.
place: National Civil Rights Museum - Lorraine Motel

title: Great Service in a beautiful location
text: Traveling with my husband for work, we stayed here and it was great. A beautiful location, surrounded by grass and trees, the hotel was clean and modern. The breakfast buffet was excellent. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Quaint and charming with excellent food
text: Stopped here for lunch and the food & service were excellent. Friendly staff, prompt service and really good food for a nice low price - what's not to like.

title: YUMMY
text: Wow - what incredible food. My husband surprised me with concert tickets and we came here for a pre-concert dinner before heading over to Comerica theatre. We started with the highly recommended pretzel fondue and it was fabulous. My husband had steak and scallops and he raved about his meal, especially the horseradish sauce. I had a filet and crab and it was incredible, so tender and perfectly cooked. It came with the most amazing creamed spinach. We finished our meal with the salted carmel pudding and I can honestly say that I have never had better pudding - it was simply delicious. They do have a nice outside patio area but in August it was still too hot to enjoy the outside seating. I will definitely come back, the Arrogant Butcher was fantastic.

title: Friendly service & good food
text: A great place to grab a burger. Even though it was a weekend and they were really busy, the service was friendly and attentive. The food was good - my hubby and daughter loved the milkshakes. A really great place to grab some lunch or dinner after a day at the beach

title: Really good food
text: My daughter insisted we try this place and it was well worth the drive. The food really was fantastic - authentic, southern cooking. The biscuits were so yummy, and everyone enjoyed their entrees.

title: Really good french bakery
text: The pastries were very good, but they expensive. Over $2.00 for a single macaron. The croissant was buttery and flakey, one of the best I've had outside of actually going to France. The cafe is very small and not very pretty to look at, but the food is definitely worth the trip

title: Great atmosphere
text: A fun place to eat, the food was good, and the service was very friendly but they were not very efficient (my husband asked 3 different people for a refill of his soda and never did get one). The atmosphere and decor of this place is just awesome and its worth a visit here just to see all the great decorations.

title: Fun, Old West Atmosphere
text: We really enjoyed our visit, the staff was friendly and helpful and the rooms were clean. I especially enjoyed the Old West atmosphere and decorations. The main restaurant was good, basic food and the process were reasonable. The hotel is extremely convenient to jump on the bus into the park and not deal with the hassle of trying to find parking.
place: The Grand Hotel at the Grand Canyon

title: Friendly service - great location
text: Had an event to attend in Tucson so we stayed here and really enjoyed it. The hotel is centrally located, the rooms very nice ( we were up on the 9th floor - part of the Hilton Honors program) The staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet had a nice variety. I would definitely stay here again.
place: Doubletree by Hilton Tucson - Reid Park

title: Fantastic southern cooking
text: We really enjoyed our meal, the service was extremely friendly, the food was excellent. I had pulled pork on cornbread muffins and it was fantastic, my husband had something called a piggy-mac which was homemade mac-n-cheese over pulled pork and it was amazing. After plenty of sweet tea and sharing an incredible desert of peanut butter cobbler we were stuffed. I will definitely come back to Pucketts on my next trip to Tennessee

title: Family Style Fun
text: The house and grounds are stunning, but what makes Monell's so interesting is the atmosphere. Guests are seated together at long tables and food is served family style, passing bowls of incredible southern comfort foods around the table. Fried chicken, fresh biscuits and gravy, green beans, pulled pork, cornbread dressing, the bowls kept on coming until my plate was overflowing and everything tasted excellent.

title: Too beautiful to miss
text: The vineyards and grounds are gorgeous, and not only can you come in for a reasonably priced tasting, but you can choose a 'picnic' version of the wine tasting and staff will hand you a tray with plastic glasses so you can go enjoy your wine on the patin or at one of the lovely picnic tables throughout the grounds. The wines are okay, my favorite was the appropriately named 'Antebellum' which is aged in old oak whiskey barrels giving it an interesting finish. My daughter just loves the desert wines - the blackberry is her favorite. All of the wines are reasonably priced.

title: Convenient location and great service
text: I attended a conference and stayed at the Renaissance, it was conveniently located with a skybridge to all the conference activities, and literally across the street from the Brickyard shops and restaurants and just a short walk away from the Oklahoma City National Memorial and Museum and the Myriad Botanical Gardens. The Hotel staff were friendly, the rooms were nice and the lobby felt serene with water features. The open air atrium gave the hotel such an open and expansive feeling. I would recommend this location to anyone who visits Oklahoma City.

title: A Must See
text: The Memorial is beautiful and moving, the friendly park staff were helpful and shared the rationale behind the design decisions. The empty chairs and the survivor tree are very impactful.

title: Lovely gardens
text: Lush and beautiful. Perfect for an afternoon stroll, with water features for children, sitting areas and much more. Well worth a visit.

title: Gorgeous
text: I was pleasantly surprised by the lovely décor, the area surrounding the hotel is beautiful. I really liked the extra touches, like the flower tissue art in the bath room and the fresh warm cookies in the lobby. The rooms were nice, clean and well kept and our view out the window was serene. I was also pleasantly surprised by the breakfast bar - which included hot bacon and eggs. The staff was friendly, I would definitely stay here again.

title: fun western atmosphere
text: It felt like a trip back in time with the fun and quirky bar decorations and lots of local clientele. I had the chicken fried steak and there was enough on my plate to feed an army. The prices are a little high, but the atmosphere was a blast.

title: Historic and fun
text: We enjoyed our stay at the General Palmer, it is right in Downtown, close to all the shops and the train station. I love the history of the building & my favorite was the journal singed by previous room guests that we found in our room. I was told this hotel is haunted (a fun fact I shared with my kids, which made the stay even more excited for them). It was a nice break from large impersonal chain hotels, lots of charm.

title: Spectacular scenery & wonderful hot springs
text: Ouray is one of the prettiest places on earth. The Box Canyon Lodge is located just at the edge of town, you can walk to downtown, but it is a few blocks. The rooms are basic and clean, but the hotel is nestled up to a hillside and the three different hot spring hot tubs were wonderful. Sitting in the hot tub surrounded by spectacular mountain views - it was fantastic and so relaxing. The hotel is right next tot he incredible falls (its worth the effort to go see them). We would stay here again.
